ax.ha.it.smsalarm

Class NoiseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ax.ha.it.smsalarm.NoiseHandler

  • public class NoiseHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for all sound and vibration handling. This means playing tones, vibrate and so on, depending on application and phone settings.
    NoiseHandler is a singleton.
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.2.1
    Author:
    Robert Nyholm
    See Also:
    RingerModeHandler

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static NoiseHandler getInstance()
        Method to get the singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of NoiseHandler

      • makeNoise

        public void makeNoise(Context context,
             int id,
             boolean useSoundSettings,
             boolean playToneTwice)
        Method to play message tone and vibrate, depending on application settings. This method also takes in account the operating systems sound settings, this depends on a input parameter.
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        id - ToneId as Integer
        useSoundSettings - If this method should take consideration to the device's sound settings as Boolean
        playToneTwice - Indication whether message tone should be played once or twice, this is the same for vibration also
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Can occur when setting data source for media player or preparing media player
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Can occur when setting data source for media player or preparing media player
        java.io.IOException - Can occur when setting data source for media player or preparing media player. Also when resolving message tone id
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String), logCatTxt(LogPriorities, String, String, Throwable)

      • msgToneLookup

        public java.lang.String msgToneLookup(Context context,
                             int toneId)
        Method to lookup proper message tone from media.
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        toneId - ToneId as Integer
        Returns:
        toneId Message tone as String
        See Also:
        logCat(LogPriorities, String, String)
